answers.answer: finally i have somone going throu the same thing am almost going throu...although i never vomited....but i always have the feeling like am going to vomit...i never do...please if you get an answer to your question let me know to..but...the dr told me...it could be because of my low iron...but i dont know about that...i started feeling like that ever since i stoped the pill...i was on yasmeen...i stoped it after 4 years of taking the pill..and ever since am not normal...its been a year since i stoped the pill and my period came maybe only twice for 2 days....so maybe it could be from the horomon mess..i dont know...but with me...it started with mild headache...night sweats...numbness in the face...and hands and aching in the limbs...and its getting worse i cant go to sleep without taking 2 pills of advil...to the point where i started poking myself so i would tell my self no...am not feeling numb....so plz let me know if you get an answer...thanks

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!If you are a female and in menopausal age group then night sweats are a common occurrence. This can be corrected by hormone replacement therapy. Other causes include AIDS, cancer, infections in the body and side effect of certain drugs. It can also be due to severe acidity with H pylori infection and gastric reflux, hypoglycemia, carcinoid syndromes, hyperthyroidism, and sleep disorders. At times cause cannot be found out. Common cold, sinusitis, ear infection, sensory nerve compression, peripheral neuropathy as in diabetes, inflamed wisdom tooth, impacted wisdom tooth, dental caries, etc  can all cause facial numbness and pain. In your case it could be a combination of infection and maybe acidity, hypoglycemia or thyroid disorders. Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Take care!

question: I have in the past few days had, night sweats, a numb face and hands and a mild headache. Also weakness and aching in the limbs. Vomiting in the first night....
title: Numb face and hands and night sweats
